data.title: It's-a me. Mario!
data.solution:
# Read input
N = int(input())
stage = input()
actions = input()

# Player state: 0 = dead, 1 = small, 2 = big
state = 1  # Start as small

for i in range(N):
    cell = stage[i]
    action = actions[i]
    
    # If already dead, stay dead
    if state == 0:
        continue

    # Check for mushroom
    if cell == 'M':
        state = 2  # Become big

    # Check for enemy
    elif cell == 'T' or cell == 'G':
        if action == 'J':
            # Jumped over enemy, state unchanged
            pass
        else:
            # Didn't jump
            if state == 1:
                # Small player dies
                state = 0
            elif state == 2:
                # Big player becomes small
                state = 1

# Output result
if state == 0:
    print("no")
elif state == 1:
    print("yes")
else:  # state == 2
    print("YES!!")
data.statement:
You are given a side-scrolling game similar to Super Mario Bros.
The player moves forward automatically through a stage one position at a time,
and their actions (jump or walk) are predefined.
The action may affect the outcome at that position (see the encounters below), but it does not move the player.
Determine whether the player can reach the end of the stage alive.

<<Game Rules>>
The player starts as Small.
Each turn, the player moves forward one position and performs their predefined action (jump or walk).
If Small player encounters an enemy ({{T}} or {{G}}) without jumping ({{J}}), the player dies.
If Big player encounters an enemy without jumping, the player becomes Small.
Jumping over an enemy ({{J}}) keeps the player's state unchanged.
Collecting a Mushroom ({{M}}) makes the player Big (regardless of jumping or not).
Once the player dies, they remain dead for the rest of the stage.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given a side-scrolling game similar to Super Mario Bros.
The player moves forward automatically through a stage one position at a time,
and their actions (jump or walk) are predefined.
The action may affect the outcome at that position (see the encounters below), but it does not move the player.
Determine whether the player can reach the end of the stage alive.

Game Rules
The player starts as Small.
Each turn, the player moves forward one position and performs their predefined action (jump or walk).
If Small player encounters an enemy (T or G) without jumping (J), the player dies.
If Big player encounters an enemy without jumping, the player becomes Small.
Jumping over an enemy (J) keeps the player's state unchanged.
Collecting a Mushroom (M) makes the player Big (regardless of jumping or not).
Once the player dies, they remain dead for the rest of the stage.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the length of the stage.
Line 2: A string of N characters representing the stage, where:
. nothing
T enemy (Turtle)
G enemy (Goomba)
M Mushroom power-up
Line 3: A string of N characters representing the player's actions, where:
. no action (walk)
J jump
Output
Line 1: YES!! if the player reaches the end as Big, yes if the player reaches the end as Small, or no if the player dies at any point.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 10
Example
Input
3
.T.
.J.
Output
yes
